The source best illustrates which of the following aspects of religions in the period circa 600 B.C.E.–600 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. Some empires imposed uniformity of belief systems across their domains.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Some empires advocated syncretism in belief systems across their domains.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Some empires were predominantly areligious.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Some empires justified their existence to divine will.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

This question is asking about aspects of religion as described in the passage. The passage is Kerdir's account of his career, focusing on his attempts to spread his brand of Zoroastrianism at the expense of other faiths in Persia. Eliminate answer choices that do not mention something along the lines of converting people. Choice (A) is exactly that, so keep it. Choice (B) is the opposite, as it discusses syncretism, which refers to the merging of different cultures, religions, or schools of thought; eliminate (B). Choice (C) discusses a lack of religion, which also does not go along with the passage, so eliminate it. Choice (D), which discusses empires using divine will to justify their rule, is historically correct but not supported by the text, so eliminate it. The correct answer is (A).

The source best supports which of the following inferences about sources of political authority in the period circa 600 B.C.E.–600 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule by their sponsorship of religion and chief priests.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Rulers were limited in their political authority by powerful religious figures.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule through victories over foreign peoples.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Rulers derived legitimacy for their rule through the consent of those they governed.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

This question asks about sources of political authority, as inferred from the passage. The passage is written by a chief priest of the Sassanid Empire, Kerdir, who has been promoted by various kings over the course of his lifetime. Therefore, the correct answer should reflect this interaction. Choice (A) is indeed supported by the passage, so keep it. Choice (B) inserts an opposite reading by stating that the priests exerted control over their rulers. While this may be historically true, it is not supported by the text, so eliminate it. Choice (C) mentions foreign peoples; even though the passage discusses suppression of non-Zoroastrian peoples, foreign peoples are not mentioned, so eliminate (C). Choice (D) discusses the consent of the governed, which is also not supported by the passage, so eliminate it. The correct answer is (A).

Which of the following best describes Persia's relationship with Arabia in the period 600–1450 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. Persian armies were largely in control of Arabia throughout the period.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Persia and Arabia interacted infrequently throughout the period.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Persia supported Arabian client states throughout the period.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Persia was brought into the Arabian orbit over the course of the period.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

Here, you're asked about the interactions between Persia and Arabia in the period 600 to 1450 C.E. Historically, the armies of Islam, starting in Arabia, overran the Sassanid Empire around 650 C.E., so find the choice that matches best with this idea. Choice (A) references the idea that Persia conquered Arabia, which is the opposite of what you're looking for, so eliminate (A). Choice (B), the idea that the two nations did not interact with each other, is not true, so eliminate (B). Choice (C), the idea that the Persians supported Arab client states, is true for the period 600 B.C.E.–600 C.E.; this is not the correct period, so eliminate (C). Choice (D), which states Persia was overrun by Arabia, is true, so keep it. The correct answer is (D).

content:
"From the confines of Jerusalem and the city of Constantinople a horrible tale has gone forth and very frequently has been brought to our ears, namely, that a race from the kingdom of the Persians, an accursed race, a race utterly alienated from God, a generation forsooth which has not directed its heart and has not entrusted its spirit to God, has invaded the lands of those Christians and has depopulated them by the sword, pillage and fire; it has led away a part of the captives into its own country, and a part it has destroyed by cruel tortures; it has either entirely destroyed the churches of God or appropriated them for the rites of its own religionâ€¦.The kingdom of the Greeks is now dismembered by them and deprived of territory so vast in extent that it cannot be traversed in a march of two months. On whom therefore is the labor of avenging these wrongs and of recovering this territory incumbent, if not upon you? You, upon whom above other nations God has conferred remarkable glory in arms, great courage, bodily activity, and strength to humble the hairy scalp of those who resist you.
Let the deeds of your ancestors move you and incite your minds to manly achievements; the glory and greatness of king Charles the Great, and of his son Louis, and of your other kings, who have destroyed the kingdoms of the pagans, and extended in these lands the territory of the holy church. Let the holy sepulchre of the Lord our Savior, which is possessed by unclean nations, especially incite you, and the holy places which are now treated with ignominy and irreverently polluted with their filthiness. Oh, most valiant soldiers and descendants of invincible ancestors, be not degenerate, but recall the valor of your progenitors.
Jerusalem is the navel of the world; the land is fruitful above others, like another paradise of delights. This the Redeemer of the human race has made illustrious by His advent, has beautified by residence, has consecrated by suffering, has redeemed by death, has glorified by burial. This royal city, therefore, situated at the center of the world, is now held captive by His enemies, and is in subjection to those who do not know God, to the worship of the heathens. She seeks therefore and desires to be liberated and does not cease to implore you to come to her aid. From you especially she asks succor, because, as we have already said, God has conferred upon you above all nations great glory in arms. Accordingly undertake this journey for the remission of your sins, with the assurance of the imperishable glory of the kingdom of heaven."
Pope Urban II, Speech at the Council of Clermont as recorded by Robert the Monk, 1095 C.E.

The speech above is best understood in context of which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. The Mongol invasions of the Middle East</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Protestant Reformation</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The Age of Discovery</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The Crusades</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

This speech calls on Christian warriors to defend the Byzantine Empire and retake Jerusalem from Muslim armies. Eliminate (A) because there is nothing explicitly stated about the Mongol invasions in the passage, and the Mongols did not appear in the Middle East until the 1250s. Eliminate (B) because the Protestant Reformation is not centered around Jerusalem and did not take place until the early 1500s. Eliminate (C) because the Age of Discovery was not centered around Jerusalem and Constantinople. The answer is (D).

Urban II's discussion of Jerusalem in the third paragraph is best understood in the context of which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. Pilgrimages to centers of religious significance</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Eradication of heresies</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The reconstruction of trade routes</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Developments in religious art</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The Crusades can be viewed as a form of pilgrimage, in which devout worshippers travel to a place of religious significance as a form of worship. This idea best matches (A). Eliminate (B) because the Crusades were not waged against a heretical interpretation so much as a different religion entirely. Eliminate (C) because although the Crusades invigorated trade in the Mediterranean, the speech itself doesn't mention this. Eliminate (D) because there is no mention of art in the passage.

Which of the following events most directly inspired Urban's invocation of Constantinople in the first paragraph?

answers.A: <label>A. The conquest of Constantinople by the armies of the Abbasid Caliphate</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The invasion of Anatolia by the Seljuk Turks</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The invasion of the Balkans by the Avars and Bulgars</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The conversion of the people of Constantinople to Catholic Christianity</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

The Crusades were initiated in no small part by calls from the Byzantine emperor for help fighting the Seljuk Turks. Eliminate (A) because the Abbasids failed to conquer Constantinople. Eliminate (C) because the Avars and the Bulgars were not Muslims. Eliminate (D) because although the emperors of the Byzantine Empire in later years made strides in patching up religious differences between West and East, the majority of the Byzantine population remained staunchly Orthodox. The answer is (B).

Which of the following events was most directly the result of the speech presented above?

answers.A: <label>A. The failure of any Christian campaign to reclaim the Levant</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The decline of Mediterranean trade routes</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The conquest of Constantinople by Latin Christians</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The decisive defeat of the Seljuk Turks by Byzantine forces</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

The Crusades were initially very successful in conquering Jerusalem and the Levant, but determined Muslim resistance pushed the Christians out, and the Fourth Crusade conquered Constantinople instead of fighting against the armies of Islam. Choice (A) is historically untrue, so eliminate it. Eliminate (B) because the Crusades helped build Mediterranean trade routes, and this choice states the opposite. Eliminate (D) because the Byzantines were decisively beaten by the Turks, not the other way around. The correct answer is (C).

content:
"The Chinese are all infidels: they worship images, and burn their dead just like the [Hindus]. The King of China is a Tartar, and one of the descendants of [Ghenghis] Khan…In all the Chinese provinces, there is a town for the [Muslims], and in this they reside. They also have cells, colleges, and mosques, and are made much of by the Kings of China…
When we approached this city [of Hangzhou] we were met by its judge, the [elders] of Islamism, and the great merchants. The [Muslims] are exceedingly numerous here. This whole city is surrounded by a wall: each of the six [districts of Hangzhou] is also surrounded by a wall. In the first reside the guards, with their commander. I was told that, in the muster-rolls, these amount to twelve thousand…In the second division are the Jews, Christians, and the Turks who worship the sun: these are numerous, their number is not known: and theirs is the most beautiful city. Their streets are well disposed, and their great men are exceedingly wealthy. There are in the city a great number of [Muslims], with some of whom I resided for fifteen days; and was treated most [honorably]…"
Ibn Battuta, Voyages, 1332–1346 C.E.

The observations expressed in the excerpt are best seen as evidence for which of the following in Yuan China?

answers.A: <label>A. Policies of religious toleration</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Instatement of foreigners as provincial administrators</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Mongol assimilation into Chinese culture</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Military pressures from internal unrest</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Ibn Battuta's description of Hangzhou mentions that a variety of religions were practiced in the city. Choice (A) supports this idea and is the correct answer. Eliminate (B) because the passage does not explicitly state that these non-Mongolians are administrators. Eliminate (C) because there is no evidence of Mongolian assimilation in this passage. Finally, eliminate (D) because there is no mention of the population revolting, just lots of city guards.

Which of the following conclusions about the period 600 C.E.–1450 C.E. is most directly supported by the passage?

answers.A: <label>A. Long-distance contact between civilizations stagnated.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. New religious traditions overturned prior lasting religious beliefs.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The empires of steppe nomads united trade links across Eurasia.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Technological developments spread across trade routes.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

Ibn Battuta managed to travel throughout the Muslim world and even beyond. Eliminate (A) because it contradicts the ideas in the passage. You can also eliminate (B) because the passage doesn't really indicate that new religions displaced old beliefs. Eliminate (D) because the passage does not mention new technologies. Choice (C) is the best answer.

content:
"The Chinese are all infidels: they worship images, and burn their dead just like the [Hindus]. The King of China is a Tartar, and one of the descendants of [Ghenghis] Khan…In all the Chinese provinces, there is a town for the [Muslims], and in this they reside. They also have cells, colleges, and mosques, and are made much of by the Kings of China…
When we approached this city [of Hangzhou] we were met by its judge, the [elders] of Islamism, and the great merchants. The [Muslims] are exceedingly numerous here. This whole city is surrounded by a wall: each of the six [districts of Hangzhou] is also surrounded by a wall. In the first reside the guards, with their commander. I was told that, in the muster-rolls, these amount to twelve thousand…In the second division are the Jews, Christians, and the Turks who worship the sun: these are numerous, their number is not known: and theirs is the most beautiful city. Their streets are well disposed, and their great men are exceedingly wealthy. There are in the city a great number of [Muslims], with some of whom I resided for fifteen days; and was treated most [honorably]…"
Ibn Battuta, Voyages, 1332–1346 C.E.

Which of the following changes to Chinese policies regarding trade occurred under the Ming Dynasty of China?

answers.A: <label>A. The Chinese government restricted foreign merchants to specific sites in the coastal cities.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Chinese government monopolized the production and sale of key resources, such as salt and iron.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The Chinese government endorsed Chinese merchants to conduct trade missions abroad.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The Chinese government abandoned Confucian principles to allow merchants a greater participation in local government.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The Ming Dynasty arose out of the ashes of Mongol mismanagement and followed a policy of restricting outside influences in China, lest foreigners retake the country. The choice that best aligns with this idea is (A). Eliminate (B), as this first occurred in the Han Dynasty and is not a Ming innovation. Eliminate (C) because after the voyages of Zheng He, the Ming government ceased to finance seaborne voyages of significance. Eliminate (D), as the Ming actually followed Neo-Confucian policies.

Compared to the observations expressed in the excerpt, Mongol administration of its Russian domains in the period 600 C.E. to 1450 C.E. differed in that it

answers.A: <label>A. was only tolerant of Orthodox Christianity, while the Mongol administration in China favored many religious traditions</label>
answers.B: <label>B. relied heavily on tribute from the Russian principalities, while the Mongol administration in China emulated a centralized Chinese bureaucratic state</label>
answers.C: <label>C. was viewed favorably by its subjects, while the Mongol administration in China encountered immense domestic unrest</label>
answers.D: <label>D. stimulated Russian export of trade goods to China, while the Mongol administration in China intentionally curtailed Chinese economic activity</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

The Mongols ruled Russia as if it were a protection racket, exacting tribute from the Russian principalities but leaving direct administration to the princes themselves. This matches (B). Eliminate (A) because the Russian Mongols eventually converted to Islam. Eliminate (C) because the Russians chafed under Mongol rule and revolted themselves. Finally, eliminate (D) because the Mongols stimulated Chinese production and economic activity as much as possible for their own taxation purposes.

content:
Source 1:
"Moreover, Sir, in our Kingdoms there is another great inconvenience which is of little service to God, and this is that many of our people, keenly desirous as they are of the wares and things of your Kingdoms, which are brought here by your people, and in order to satisfy their voracious appetite, seize many of our people, freed and exempt men, and very often it happens that they kidnap even noblemen and our relatives, and take them to be sold to the white men who are in our kingdoms."
Letter from King Afonso I of Kongo to King John III of Portugal, 1526
Source 2:
"This expedition has cost us much: it would be unreasonable to send it home with empty hands. Although our [principal] wish is to serve God and the pleasure of the king of Kongo, none the less you will make him understand—as though speaking in our name—what he should do to fill the ships, whether with slaves, or copper, or ivory."
Instructions from King Manuel of Portugal to his envoy in Kongo, 1512

The interactions described in the letters are best understood in the context of which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. Portuguese exploration of the coast of West Africa</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Catholic missionary efforts in Sub-Saharan Africa</label>
answers.C: <label>C. State formation in Sub-Saharan Africa</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Development of the slave trade in Sub-Saharan Africa</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

Both sources mention slavery either as the main point (Source 1) or in passing as a commodity (Source 2). Eliminate answer choices that do not focus on slavery. Choices (A), (B), and (C) do not mention slavery, so (D) is the answer.

The tone of the second letter best reflects which of the following developments in early modern Europe?

answers.A: <label>A. The acquisition of African slaves for cash crop cultivation in the New World</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The centrality of commercial activity in motivating European expansion</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The desire to explore beyond traditional European waters</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The establishment of Jesuit missions in distant regions of the world</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Source 2 claims that the expedition that set sail to Kongo needs to pay its own way, so eliminate answer choices that do not focus on making money—namely, (C) and (D). The letter doesn't explicitly state that the slaves are going to the New World, so eliminate (A). This leaves you with (B), which is correct.

The two letters best support which of the following conclusions?

answers.A: <label>A. Diplomatic relations between Portugal and Kongo were often cordial.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Kongolese noblemen were frequently taken as slaves by the Portuguese.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Trade between Portugal and Kongo was highly regulated.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Trade between Portugal and Kongo was brisk with both parties.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

Both sources indicate that trade between Portugal and Kongo happened frequently, either to the Kongolese people's misfortune or for the acquisition of raw materials. Choice (A) is not justifiable based on the text of Source 2, since it advocates extorting resources from the Kongolese; eliminate (A). Only Source 1 supports (B), so eliminate this choice as well. Choice (C) is not supported by the passages, so eliminate (C). You are exam_ins with (D), which is the answer.

The tone of the first letter best reflects which of the following developments in early modern Africa?

answers.A: <label>A. A growing dependence on trade with Europe for manufactured goods</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Vigorous resistance to European expeditions of conquest</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The establishment of Portuguese trading posts along the coastline</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The consolidation of states along the Atlantic coast of Africa</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Sub-Saharan Africans often traded for European guns and manufactures, so much so that some African states' power derived from guns bought by selling slaves to Europeans. Eliminate (B) because the letter (Source 1) doesn't express much in the way of resistance. Eliminate (C) because the source doesn't explicitly discuss the trading posts Portugal established—only the Portuguese present in Kongo. Eliminate (D) because the letter does not mention anything about the consolidation of Kongo.

content:
"The question as to who, and what, is responsible for African underdevelopment can be answered at two levels. Firstly, the answer is that the operation of the imperialist system bears major responsibility for African economic retardation by draining African wealth and by making it impossible to develop more rapidly the resources of the continent. Secondly, one has to deal with those who manipulate the system and those who are either agents or unwitting accomplices of the said system. The capitalists of Western Europe were the ones who actively extended their exploitation from inside Europe to cover the whole of Africa."
Walter Rodney, historian, How Europe Underdeveloped Africa, 1974

Rodney's argument in the passage is most likely a response to which of the following developments of the period 1450 to 1750 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. The colonization of the interior of Africa by European powers</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The expansion of the African diaspora to the New World</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The spread of Christianity into Sub-Saharan Africa</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The importation of New World products into Africa</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Rodney's argument is that Europe's colonization efforts, compounded with the capitalist system, impoverished Africa. Eliminate answer choices that do not reflect this argument, such as (C) and (D). Historically, the Europeans only settled the coastlines between 1450 and 1750, so (A) is also incorrect. The answer is (B).

Which of the following would best support the author's assertion that Western European capitalists were responsible for African underdevelopment?

answers.A: <label>A. The aggressive expansion of the slave trade to provide labor for Caribbean sugar plantations</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The continuous sale of African slaves by Arabian merchants into the Mediterranean market</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The establishment of Cape Colony by the Dutch East India Company</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The growth of trade links between Europe and Ethiopia</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Here, you should be looking for an answer choice that has to do with the slave trade, a root cause of Africa's underdevelopment. Eliminate (B), as it does not deal with Western European exploitation of the slave trade. Eliminate (C) because it is not necessarily a byproduct of the slave trade. Choice (D) is too limited, so eliminate it. The best answer here is (A).

Based on your knowledge of world history, which of the following contributed LEAST to Europe's ability to penetrate Africa in the period 1750 to 1900 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. The invention of the machine gun</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The invention of vaccines for tropical diseases</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The development of the joint-stock company</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The invention of steam-powered ships</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

The question is asking for the choice that contributed LEAST to Europe's ability to penetrate Africa between 1750 and 1900. Choice (C), the development of the joint-stock company, did not occur during this time period, so it cannot have contributed to Europe's penetration of Africa. Therefore, (C) is the answer.

Which of the following best explains the importance of trading contacts with Europeans for Sub-Saharan Africans in the period 1450 to 1750 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. Sub-Saharan Africans relied on European merchants to sustain population growth through the constant importation of New World foodstuffs.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Sub-Saharan Africans consolidated new states and kingdoms by trading with the Europeans for firearms.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Sub-Saharan Africans depended on European merchants as the sole purchasers of slaves.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Sub-Saharan Africans allied with European powers to evict Muslim and Arab merchant princes from encroaching on their sovereignty.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Sub-Saharan African states relied largely on trade with Europe to purchase guns necessary to capture other slaves and expand their own state structures. Eliminate (C), as Europeans were not the only buyers of slaves. Eliminate (D) because it refers to Ethiopia specifically and not the whole of Sub-Saharan Africa. Eliminate (A) because it implies that New World foods were constantly shuttled into Africa to feed the population of the continent; while New World foods were brought into Africa, after the initial contact, Africans grew New World foods in Africa itself. Therefore, (B) is correct.

Explanation:

The map depicts the Dutch East India Company's capital at Batavia. Note that the city is focused on a fort and a garrison barracks along the exterior at prominent positions; this should help you identify (C) as the correct answer. Eliminate (A) because the Dutch did not focus much on converting people. Eliminate (B) because the map's legend does not include shipyards or docks. Eliminate (D) because the legend lacks any mention of spices.

The variety of places of worship shown on the map of Batavia was most likely the result of which of the following broader processes from 600 to 1450 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. The split in the Muslim world following the usurpation of the Caliphate from the Umayyads by the Abassids</label>

Eliminate (A) because the caliphates did not control Indonesia. Eliminate (C) because the crusaders did not reach Indonesia. Eliminate (D) because the Mongolians did not succeed in their invasion of Java. Choice (B) is the best answer.

content:
"The quicksilver mines of Huancavelica are where the poor Indians are so harshly punished, where they are tortured and so many Indians die; it is there that the noble caciques [headmen] of this kingdom are finished off and tortured. The same is true in all the other mines: the silver mines of Potosi [and others]….The owners and stewards of the mines, whether Spaniards, mestizos, or Indians, are such tyrants, with no fear of God or Justice, because they are not audited and are not inspected twice a year….
And they are not paid for the labor of traveling to and from the mines or for the time they spend at the mines. The Indians, under the pretext of mining chores, are made to spend their workdays herding cattle and conveying goods; they are sent off to the plains, and the Indians die. These Indians are not paid for their labor, and their work is kept hidden.
And [the mine owners] keep Indian cooking women in their residences; they use cooking as a pretext for taking concubines….And they oblige the Indians to accept corn or meat or chicha [corn beer]…at their own expense, and they deduct the price from their labor and their workdays. In this way, the Indians end up very poor and deep in debt, and they have no way to pay their tribute.
There is no remedy for all this, because any [colonial official] who enters comes to an agreement with the mine owners, and all the owners join forces in bribing him….Even the protector of the Indians is useless;…he [does not] warn Your Majesty or your royal Audiencia [court] about the harms done to the poor Indians."
Excerpt from The First New Chronicle and Good Government [abridged], by Felipe Guaman Poma de Alaya. Selected, translated, and annotated by David Frye. Copyright 2006 Hackett Publishing Company. Reprinted with permission from the publisher.
Felipe Guaman Poma de Ayala, The First New Chronicle and Good Government, ca. 1610

The views expressed in the passage are best seen as evidence for which of the following in the society of Spanish South America?

answers.A: <label>A. The formal adoption of debt slavery as a means to clear debts</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The absence of corruption among elites</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The king's lack of interest in the welfare of Native American subjects</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The imposition of social stratification based on origin of birth</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

The passage discusses the treatment of aboriginal natives in South America by the Spanish in their silver mines. Recall that in the Spanish colonies, a caste system existed according to race and birthplace, which is closest to (D). Eliminate (B), as it is a reversal of what is stated in the passage. Eliminate (C) because the letter is written to the king, who is ostensibly worried about his subjects in the last sentence. Eliminate (A) because it is less directly supported in the passage than (D).

Which of the following conclusions about the period 1450–1750 C.E. is most directly supported by the passage?

answers.A: <label>A. The population of the Americas declined.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Silver flows from the Americas went principally to Europe and Asia.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The religious traditions and social customs of the New World were dramatically altered by the arrival of Europeans.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Intermarriage between Spanish colonists and natives led to equality between the races.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The passage indicates that many of the natives sent to the mines did not return. Eliminate (B) because the passage does not say where the silver was spent. Eliminate (C) because the passage does not discuss social transformations. Eliminate (D) because the passage does not indicate that there were any feelings of equality between Spaniards and natives. The best answer is (A).

Compared to the practices in the excerpt, English treatment of the natives in the New World differed in that they

answers.A: <label>A. viewed the natives as true equals as they settled the Americas</label>
answers.B: <label>B. were confused by the natives' lack of a notion of land ownership</label>
answers.C: <label>C. widely did not condone intermingling with the natives</label>
answers.D: <label>D. used the natives exclusively for harvesting cash crops, like tobacco and cotton</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

The English did not intermarry with the natives like the Spaniards did, and their colonies were largely distinct from native settlements. Therefore, (C) is correct. Eliminate (A), which is demonstrably false. Eliminate (B) because wars between English colonists and natives over land were common. Eliminate (D) because the English also employed African slaves for cash-crop harvesting in the southern colonies.

And they are not paid for the labor of traveling to and from the mines or for the time they spend at the mines. The Indians, under the pretext of mining chores, are made to spend their workdays herding cattle and conveying goods; they are sent off to the plains, and the Indians die. These Indians are not paid for their labor, and their work is kept hidden.
And [the mine owners] keep Indian cooking women in their residences; they use cooking as a pretext for taking concubines….And they oblige the Indians to accept corn or meat or chicha [corn beer]…at their own expense, and they deduct the price from their labor and their workdays. In this way, the Indians end up very poor and deep in debt, and they have no way to pay their tribute.
There is no remedy for all this, because any [colonial official] who enters comes to an agreement with the mine owners, and all the owners join forces in bribing him….Even the protector of the Indians is useless;…he [does not] warn Your Majesty or your royal Audiencia [court] about the harms done to the poor Indians."
Excerpt from The First New Chronicle and Good Government [abridged], by Felipe Guaman Poma de Alaya. Selected, translated, and annotated by David Frye. Copyright 2006 Hackett Publishing Company. Reprinted with permission from the publisher.
Felipe Guaman Poma de Ayala, The First New Chronicle and Good Government, ca. 1610

Which of the following changes to the Spanish policies towards Native Americans occurred on account of the practices described in the passage?

answers.A: <label>A. The replacement of native laborers in the mines with an almost exclusively African slave workforce</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The foundation of viceroyalties to allow for more effective royal administration of native relations</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The promulgation of royal decrees insisting on more humane treatment of the natives</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The enfranchisement of all natives by local Spanish elites in the colonies</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

The passage discusses the mistreatment of natives in the Spanish mines, and the fact that the mit'a system and other such forms of exploitation killed a great many natives. The Spanish monarchy actually banned such exploitative measures and tried to impose laws demanding humane treatment. Therefore, (C) is correct.

content:
"The quicksilver mines of Huancavelica are where the poor Indians are so harshly punished, where they are tortured and so many Indians die; it is there that the noble caciques [headmen] of this kingdom are finished off and tortured. The same is true in all the other mines: the silver mines of Potosi [and others]….The owners and stewards of the mines, whether Spaniards, mestizos, or Indians, are such tyrants, with no fear of God or Justice, because they are not audited and are not inspected twice a year….
And they are not paid for the labor of traveling to and from the mines or for the time they spend at the mines. The Indians, under the pretext of mining chores, are made to spend their workdays herding cattle and conveying goods; they are sent off to the plains, and the Indians die. These Indians are not paid for their labor, and their work is kept hidden.
And [the mine owners] keep Indian cooking women in their residences; they use cooking as a pretext for taking concubines….And they oblige the Indians to accept corn or meat or chicha [corn beer]…at their own expense, and they deduct the price from their labor and their workdays. In this way, the Indians end up very poor and deep in debt, and they have no way to pay their tribute.
There is no remedy for all this, because any [colonial official] who enters comes to an agreement with the mine owners, and all the owners join forces in bribing him….Even the protector of the Indians is useless;…he [does not] warn Your Majesty or your royal Audiencia [court] about the harms done to the poor Indians."
Excerpt from The First New Chronicle and Good Government [abridged], by Felipe Guaman Poma de Alaya. Selected, translated, and annotated by David Frye. Copyright 2006 Hackett Publishing Company. Reprinted with permission from the publisher.
Felipe Guaman Poma de Ayala, The First New Chronicle and Good Government, ca. 1610

The production of the mines mentioned in the passage most directly contributed to which of the following in the period 1450–1750 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. The prosecution of a variety of wars by the Spanish Hapsburgs across the world</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The development of a vibrant merchant class in Spain</label>
answers.C: <label>C. A decrease in patronage of religious activities by the monarchs of Spain</label>
answers.D: <label>D. A decrease in the frequency of voyages of exploration undertaken by the Spanish</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The mines in the passage produced silver, as stated in the first paragraph. The Spanish government relied on the silver shipments from the New World to finance its far-flung military efforts. Eliminate (B) because the Spanish never created the kind of merchant class that existed in England or the Netherlands. Eliminate (C) as well, since the Spanish monarchs were staunch supporters and patrons of Catholicism. Finally, eliminate (D) because the Spanish sent their galleons on voyages of exploration far and wide. The correct answer is (A).

content:
Source 1:
"The Sovereign Congress of Venezuela, to which authority the people of the Republic of the New Granada have voluntarily stood by.
Considering:
1. "That united in a single Republic, the provinces of Venezuela and the New Granada have all proportions and ways to elevate themselves to a higher grade of power and prosperity.
2. "That constituted in separate republics, for any more stronger the ties that these have united them, so far from taking advantages of so many advantages, they would hardly consolidate and make respect their sovereignty.
3. "That these truths, highly penetrated by superior talented men and of an enlightened patriotism, had moved the governments of both republics to convene in a reunion that the vicissitudes of wars decreed and decree the following fundamental Law of the Republic of Colombia:
ARTICLE 1. The Republics of Venezuela and New Granada are from this day on united in a single one under the glorious title of Republic of Colombia….
ARTICLE 4. The Executive Power of the Republic will be vested on the President and in case of his defect a Vice President and his replacement will be appointed interimly by the acting Congress."
Fundamental Law Establishing Gran Colombia, passed by the Congress of Angostura convened by Simon Bolivar, 1819
Source 2:
"IN THE NAME OF THE HOLY TRINITY.
TITLE 1 - Of the Empire of Brazil, its Territories, Government, dynasty, and Religion.
Art. 1. The EMPIRE of Brazil is the political association for all Brazilian citizens. These will form a free and independent nation, and will not form any other union or federation, which may cause it to lose its own Independence.
Art. 2. Its territory is divided into provinces in the form in which it currently finds itself; these may be subdivided, as is required for the good of the state.
Art. 3. Its government is a Hereditary Monarchy, constitutional, and Representative.
Art. 4. The prevailing dynasty is that of the Lord Dom Pedro I, the sitting Emperor and Perpetual Defender of Brazil.
Art. 5. The Catholic Apostolic Roman Religion will continue to be the religion of the Empire. Followers of all other religions are allowed to worship within their households, or particular houses for that intent, so long as there is nothing indicating this on the exterior of the Temple."
Constitution of the Empire of Brazil, March 25, 1824

Taken together, the two sources best illustrate which of the following aspects of political philosophy in the period circa 1750–1900 C.E.?

answers.A: <label>A. Constitutions around the world decreed representative governments for their citizens.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Monarchs exerted a great deal of influence in their nations' governments.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Military dictatorships often supplanted democratic governments.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Industrialization propelled societies to demand more social obligations from their governments.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Both sources mention legislatures, so eliminate (B). Choice (C) is true, but not reflected in either of the passages. Choice (D) is also not mentioned in either passage, so eliminate it. Choice (A), the idea that constitutions around the world established representative governments, is correct.

Which of the following is most directly responsible for creating the constitutions above?

answers.A: <label>A. Nationalist movements advocating pan-Americanism</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Revolts organized by provincial elites in Latin American nations</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Aboriginal natives gathering the support of provincials to create constitutions</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Colonial powers preparing their colonies for independence</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Latin American independence movements were typically organized by the native-born elites and not the European-born aristocrats, so eliminate (C) and (D). Choice (A) is the opposite of what actually transpired, so eliminate it. Choice (B) is the answer.

Which of the following would most undermine the expectations expressed in Article 1 of Source 1?

answers.A: <label>A. Intervention by the United States and European powers in the independence of Latin American countries</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Nationalism in Latin America pressing for stronger unity between the former Spanish colonies of South America</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Slave rebellions fragmenting newly independent Latin American states</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Sectionalism of elites in the various territories of newly independent Latin American states</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

The former Spanish colonies, once free, were united for a brief time but later split ways due to irreconcilable differences stemming from their vast distances from each other; eliminate (B). While the United States and Europe did intervene in Latin American affairs, those interventions were not typically designed to fragment Latin American states, so eliminate (A). Slavery existed in some of the Spanish colonies, but the revolutions were inspired by Enlightenment ideals that usually involved freeing the slaves, so eliminate (C). Choice (D) is correct.

Which of the following inferences about religion in the period 1750–1900 C.E. is supported by Source 2?

answers.A: <label>A. Religious uniformity was expected of the citizens of most states in the period.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Religious toleration gained acceptance with the laws of most states in the period.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Religious authority was the basis of the divine right of monarchs to rule their states in the period.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Religious influence on the populations of states declined due to scientific advancements.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Source 2, the Constitution of the Empire of Brazil, claims that Catholicism is the state religion of Brazil but allows for religious toleration for other creeds as well, so eliminate (A). Choice (C) is not explicitly mentioned in Source 2, so eliminate (C). Choice (D) is true of the period but not reflected in the source either, so eliminate it. Choice (B) is correct.

content:
"MAHATMA GANDHI'S MESSAGE.
REMAIN NON-VIOLENT
The following message was sent by Mahatma Gandhi from Waltair:â€”
Maulana Mohamed AH was arrested at Waltair under sections 107 and 108 to be called upon to give security, to be of good behaviour for one year. The place and date of trial is unknown.
The Begum Saheba and Mr. Hayat were permitted to see him after arrest.
He and I were going to address a meeting outside the station. He was arrested. I continued going to the meeting and addressed them. There is no cause for sorrow, but every cause for congratulation. There should be no hartal. Perfect peace and calmness should be observed. I regard the arrest as a prelude to Swaraj and the redress of the Khilafat and the Punjab wrongs, if we can remain non-violent. Retain Hindu-Muslim Unity despite the madness of some Moplahs, and fulfil the Swadeshi programme.
I hope every Indian, man or woman, will completely boycott foreign cloth and take up spinning or weaving during every spare minute.
By striving like the Maulana, be insistent on religious and national rights.
Let us earn imprisonment. I am conscious of the Maulana's innocence and I am sure the imprisonment of the innocent will enable the nation to reach the cherished goal."
Mohandas Gandhi, The Pilgrims' March, 1921

The boycott mentioned in the fifth paragraph is best understood in the context of which of the following historical developments?

answers.A: <label>A. Indian protectionism from the importation of large quantities of foreign manufactured goods</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Indian efforts towards self-rule and independence</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Indian labor's collectivization and agitation for better working conditions</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Indian efforts to maintain a non-aligned status during the Cold War</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

The passage discusses Gandhi's non-violent protests as a tool to gain independence from Great Britain. Eliminate (A), (C), and (D), as these lack any connection to the independence movement. Choice (B) is the answer.

Mohandas Gandhi, The Pilgrims' March, 1921

The instructions indicated in the fourth paragraph to remain nonviolent most likely inspired which of the following historical developments?

answers.A: <label>A. The Zionist movement that created the modern state of Israel</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The independence movements that freed the states of southeast Asia from colonial rule</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The civil rights movements that changed the legal status of minorities in the United States</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The communist movement that changed the government of Cuba</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

Eliminate (B) and (D), as they involve violent revolutions, which is not what the question is asking for. Eliminate (A), as Zionism was a force before the Indian nonviolent protest movement was underway. Choice (C) is the best answer.

Which of the following historical developments from the period 1450–1750 C.E. most inspired the instructions indicated in the fifth paragraph to boycott foreign cloth?

answers.A: <label>A. The conquest of India by rival Muslim empires</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The development of joint-stock companies</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The importation of food crops from the New World</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The African slave trade</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

The boycott of foreign cloth referred to in the passage was intended to help free India from foreign rule. Therefore, eliminate any answer choice that would not result in foreigners coming to rule India. Choices (C) and (D) fall into this category, so eliminate them. While the Mughals did make gains in India during this period, the ultimate rulers of India were the British via the British East India Company, so eliminate (A). Choice (B), the development of joint-stock companies, is correct.

Mohandas Gandhi, The Pilgrims' March, 1921

Which of the following historical developments most assisted the ultimate success of the boycott mentioned in the fifth paragraph?

answers.A: <label>A. Pressure on colonial powers by the Soviet Union to retreat from their colonies</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Great Depression that started in 1929</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The decolonization process already underway in Africa</label>
answers.D: <label>D. World War II</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

As mentioned above, the goal of the boycott of foreign cloth was to free India from British rule, so eliminate any answer choice that does not involve weakening British resolve to abandon India. Choice (C), decolonization, occurred after the Indian independence movement, so it can be eliminated. Choice (B) strengthened Britain's resolve to hold onto its colonies, so it too can be eliminated. Choice (A) is plausible but not as strong as (D), especially since more direct Soviet pressure to decolonize came after World War II, during the Cold War. Choice (D) is correct.

content:
"To slacken the tempo would mean falling behind. And those who fall behind get beaten. But we do not want to be beaten. No, we refuse to be beaten! One feature of the history of old Russia was the continual beatings she suffered because of her backwardness. She was beaten by the Mongol khans. She was beaten by the Turkish beys. She was beaten by the Swedish feudal lords. She was beaten by the Polish and Lithuanian gentry. She was beaten by the British and French capitalists. She was beaten by the Japanese barons. All beat her––because of her backwardness, because of her military backwardness, cultural backwardness, political backwardness, industrial backwardness, agricultural backwardness. They beat her because it was profitable and could be done with impunity. You remember the words of the pre-revolutionary poet: "You are poor and abundant, mighty and impotent, Mother Russia." Those gentlemen were quite familiar with the verses of the old poet. They beat her, saying: "You are abundant," so one can enrich oneself at your expense. They beat her, saying: "You are poor and impotent," so you can be beaten and plundered with impunity. Such is the law of the exploiters––to beat the backward and the weak. It is the jungle law of capitalism. You are backward, you are weak––therefore you are wrong; hence you can be beaten and enslaved. You are mighty––therefore you are right; hence we must be wary of you.
That is why we must no longer lag behind."
Joseph Stalin, speech delivered at the first All-Union Conference of Leading Personnel of Socialist Industry, February 4, 1931

The speech as a whole is best understood in the context of which of the following historical developments?

answers.A: <label>A. Stalin's drive to motivate Soviet industry for the Winter War with Finland</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Stalin's push to make the Soviet Union a nuclear nation</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Stalin's implementation of five-year plans for the Soviet economy</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Stalin's purges of dissidents and other political prisoners</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

Stalin's speech is an exhortation to the managers of industry to quicken the pace of production and technological advancement. Eliminate (A) because the speech mentions nothing of offensive war. Eliminate (B) because the development of a Soviet nuclear bomb occurred much later than the speech. Eliminate (D) because the speech makes no mention of political prisoners or dissenters. Choice (C) is the answer.

The reference to the "continual beatings" most directly supports which of the following decisions in later Soviet foreign policy?

answers.A: <label>A. The invasion of Afghanistan</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The creation of the Warsaw Pact</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The imposition of the Brezhnev Doctrine against anti-Soviet protesters in Europe</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The declaration of war against Japan at the end of World War II</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Stalin firmly believed, according to this speech, that foreign nations attacked Russia because it was weak. Therefore, any foreign policy that would provide a buffer and strength to Russia proper was in Russian interests. You can eliminate (A) because the Soviets invaded Afghanistan to prop up a socialist government. Eliminate (C) because the protesters that the Soviets crushed were trying to gain independence for their countries. Eliminate (D) because the Soviets attacked Japan to gain territory and have a say in the post-war Far East.

All beat her––because of her backwardness, because of her military backwardness, cultural backwardness, political backwardness, industrial backwardness, agricultural backwardness. They beat her because it was profitable and could be done with impunity. You remember the words of the pre-revolutionary poet: "You are poor and abundant, mighty and impotent, Mother Russia." Those gentlemen were quite familiar with the verses of the old poet. They beat her, saying: "You are abundant," so one can enrich oneself at your expense. They beat her, saying: "You are poor and impotent," so you can be beaten and plundered with impunity. Such is the law of the exploiters––to beat the backward and the weak. It is the jungle law of capitalism. You are backward, you are weak––therefore you are wrong; hence you can be beaten and enslaved. You are mighty––therefore you are right; hence we must be wary of you.
That is why we must no longer lag behind."
Joseph Stalin, speech delivered at the first All-Union Conference of Leading Personnel of Socialist Industry, February 4, 1931

Stalin's efforts to advance Russia as justified by his mention of the "continual beatings" were vindicated by which of the following historical events?

answers.A: <label>A. The Space Race with the United States</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Polish-Soviet War in the early 1920s</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The Western intervention in the Russian Civil War</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The German invasion of Russia in 1941</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

Stalin's drive for Russia's advancement may have come at a grave cost, but it definitely put the Soviets in a much better position to withstand full-scale war in World War II. Eliminate (A) because the Soviet Union ultimately gave up the Space Race after the United States landed men on the moon. Eliminate (B) and (C) because they took place earlier than Stalin's speech. Choice (D) is therefore the best answer.

content:
"To slacken the tempo would mean falling behind. And those who fall behind get beaten. But we do not want to be beaten. No, we refuse to be beaten! One feature of the history of old Russia was the continual beatings she suffered because of her backwardness. She was beaten by the Mongol khans. She was beaten by the Turkish beys. She was beaten by the Swedish feudal lords. She was beaten by the Polish and Lithuanian gentry. She was beaten by the British and French capitalists. She was beaten by the Japanese barons. All beat her––because of her backwardness, because of her military backwardness, cultural backwardness, political backwardness, industrial backwardness, agricultural backwardness. They beat her because it was profitable and could be done with impunity. You remember the words of the pre-revolutionary poet: "You are poor and abundant, mighty and impotent, Mother Russia." Those gentlemen were quite familiar with the verses of the old poet. They beat her, saying: "You are abundant," so one can enrich oneself at your expense. They beat her, saying: "You are poor and impotent," so you can be beaten and plundered with impunity. Such is the law of the exploiters––to beat the backward and the weak. It is the jungle law of capitalism. You are backward, you are weak––therefore you are wrong; hence you can be beaten and enslaved. You are mighty––therefore you are right; hence we must be wary of you.
That is why we must no longer lag behind."
Joseph Stalin, speech delivered at the first All-Union Conference of Leading Personnel of Socialist Industry, February 4, 1931

Stalin's speech is most strongly influenced by which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. Appeasement</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Fascism</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Communism</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Secret treaties</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

Stalin was the leader of the Soviet Union at the time of his speech, and his lambasting of capitalist and monarchist foreign aggressors clearly shows Communist sympathies. Eliminate (A) because appeasement is more often applied to the Western democracies' relationship to Adolf Hitler's territorial demands. Eliminate (B) because fascism is the form of government followed by Mussolini and Hitler, not Stalin. Eliminate (D) because secret treaties are a hallmark of World War I, not II.

answers.B: <label>B. Military takeover of the civilian government</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The conquest of Manchuria</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Embargos and other sanctions imposed by the United States</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

The table shows that the Japanese economy grew from 1937 to 1942. Eliminate answer choices that would cause the economy to decline or are outside the time period. Choices (B) and (D) would cause the economy to decrease its output, so they can be eliminated. Choice (C) occurred outside the time period and can be eliminated as well. Choice (A) is therefore the answer.

Choice (B) would cause the economy to grow and can be eliminated. Choices (C) and (D) are possible, but neither is as strong as the literal destruction of Japanese industry by Allied forces, (A). Therefore, eliminate (C) and (D) and choose (A).

Correct Answer: B

Choice (C) might be true, but it is not historically accurate. Choice (D) is outside the time period of the table. Choice (A) is a good answer, but democracy alone cannot guarantee economic growth. The Japanese economic miracle after World War II is most credited to the Korean War, so (B) is the best answer.

content:
"Article 1
The Parties undertake, as set forth in the Charter of the United Nations, to settle any international dispute in which they may be involved by peaceful means in such a manner that international peace and security and justice are not endangered, and to refrain in their international relations from the threat or use of force in any manner inconsistent with the purposes of the United Nations.
"Article 2
The Parties will contribute toward the further development of peaceful and friendly international relations by strengthening their free institutions, by bringing about a better understanding of the principles upon which these institutions are founded, and by promoting conditions of stability and well-being. They will seek to eliminate conflict in their international economic policies and will encourage economic collaboration between any or all of them.
"Article 3
In order more effectively to achieve the objectives of this Treaty, the Parties, separately and jointly, by means of continuous and effective self-help and mutual aid, will maintain and develop their individual and collective capacity to resist armed attackâ€¦
"Article 5
The Parties agree that an armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all and consequently they agree that, if such an armed attack occurs, each of them, in exercise of the right of individual or collective self-defence recognised by Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, will assist the Party or Parties so attacked by taking forthwith, individually and in concert with the other Parties, such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain the security of the North Atlantic area."
North Atlantic Treaty, April 4, 1949

The treaty above is most clearly an example of which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. A reduction of barriers to trade across international borders</label>
answers.B: <label>B. A secret treaty to maintain the balance of power in Europe</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Reconstruction efforts to rebuild Europe after World War II</label>
answers.D: <label>D. A response to aggression from outside of Western Europe</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

The North Atlantic Treaty is the document responsible for the creation of NATO, the U.S.- centered alliance bloc in the Cold War. Eliminate (A) because NATO is focused on defense, not trade. Eliminate (B) because secret treaties occurred during World War I, not the Cold War. Eliminate (C), as it invokes the Marshall Plan, which was economic aid to Europe, not military defense as stated in the document.

North Atlantic Treaty, April 4, 1949

Based on the treaty, the United Nations mentioned in the first paragraph is an example of which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. An organization dedicated to asserting an ideological tenet over the world</label>
answers.B: <label>B. An organization opposed to the use of force between nations in any situation</label>
answers.C: <label>C. An organization dedicated to providing avenues of arbitration of disputes for the nations of the world</label>
answers.D: <label>D. An organization dedicated to expanding free trade across international borders</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

The United Nations is mentioned in the first paragraph as a forum for peaceful settlements of conflict. Eliminate (A) because it invokes NATO or the Warsaw Pact, not the United Nations. Eliminate (B) because the fourth paragraph states that the UN allows for self-defense of nations. Eliminate (D) because the passage mentions nothing about trade. Choice (C) is correct.

North Atlantic Treaty, April 4, 1949

Which of the following best explains why the North Atlantic Treaty was signed by its participating countries?

answers.A: <label>A. Because of new enfranchisement laws, citizens demanded their countries join in alliance with other nations.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The threat from opposing states was sufficient enough to join in alliance for the sake of protection.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The opportunity to re-take colonies lost after World War II could only be acted on through military alliance with other countries.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. A monopoly on nuclear warfare capabilities compelled nations to join the alliance out of fear.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

NATO was founded to provide defense against the Soviet Union for Western nations, which best aligns with (B). Eliminate (A) because many of the participating nations in NATO had largely enfranchised populations to begin with. Eliminate (C) because NATO, according to the document, is a defensive alliance. Eliminate (D) because the Soviet Union acquired atomic weapons in 1949, breaking the U.S. monopoly.

The North Atlantic Treaty in the passage above most clearly supports which of the following concepts?

answers.A: <label>A. Capitalism</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Collective defense</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Mutually assured destruction</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Communism</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

NATO is a treaty that reflects (B), collective defense—the idea that an attack on one member is an attack on all. Eliminate (A) because NATO countries are typically capitalist, but a capitalist economy is not necessary for membership. Eliminate (C) because mutually assured destruction is what happens when two nuclear parties have large enough arsenals to eradicate each other—the document doesn't support this reading at all. Eliminate (D) because the "communist" alliance in the Cold War was the Warsaw Pact, not NATO.

This image is best associated with which religious tradition?

answers.C: <label>C. Taoism</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Buddhism</label>

Correct Answer: C

The focus on nature in this painting should direct you toward Taoism, which is a belief system that seeks harmony with nature. The answer is (C).

content:
Dong Qichang, In the Silence, ca. 1602

As evidenced by the painting, Dong Qichang, along with other artists of the Ming Dynasty, attempted to create art that did which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. Excluded references to humans, in lieu of a focus on nature</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Recaptured the traditions of Chinese culture</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Borrowed extensively from South Asian cultures</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Celebrated the Mongol influence</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Following the rule of the Mongols, the Ming wanted to erase the influence of their foreign predecessors and restore Chinese culture. This led to a renaissance of classical Chinese art. Be careful with (A). While there is a strong focus on nature in this painting, there is also a small house shown. In typical Taoist fashion, the inclusion of human influence is typically negligible, emphasizing the relatively small role humans play in the grand scheme of things. The best answer is (B).

content:
Major Plagues of the Roman and Byzantine Empires

Which of the following policies would modern historians most directly blame for the spike in disease outbreak beginning with the Antonine Plague?

answers.A: <label>A. Religious persecution of Christians and Jews</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Diocletian's division of the Roman Empire</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Increased taxation on the urban class</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Many of the plagues of the ancient world were brought to major cities by returning soldiers. As Pax Romana came to an end, Roman soldiers began fighting in far corners of the empire, coming into contact with diseases that would later spread through the cities. Therefore, the correct answer is (B).

content:
Major Plagues of the Roman and Byzantine Empires

Which of the following was an important continuity underlying the outbreaks listed in the table?

answers.A: <label>A. The spread of plagues used as a form of warfare</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Surprising disease outbreaks in cities that were largely shut off from the outside world</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The resilience of large empires despite disease outbreaks</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The spread of disease in highly populated trade cities</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

One of the many factors that brought down the Roman Empire was the declining urban population. Densely populated cities, (D), declined amid devastating disease spreading by people living in close quarters and a lack of adequate sanitation. Choice (D) is correct.

content:
Major Plagues of the Roman and Byzantine Empires

The data in the table best supports which of the following conclusions?

answers.A: <label>A. Bubonic plague led to most deaths in plagues of the first millennium C.E.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Constantinople was particularly vulnerable to bubonic plague.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Plagues most severely affected the countryside.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. The Byzantine Empire dealt with more plagues than did the Roman Empire.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: B

Explanation:

Use Process of Elimination on this question. There is no evidence to suggest how many people died from all bubonic plagues in the first millennium, so eliminate (A). The table does not distinguish between urban and rural populations, so (C) does not work. Eliminate (D) because not all plagues are listed, and two of the three deal with the Roman Empire. Choice (B) is the only option consistent with the table, so it is the best answer.

content:
Major Plagues of the Roman and Byzantine Empires

The Cyprian Plague differed from the Justinian Plague in which of the following ways?

answers.A: <label>A. Christians were persecuted after being blamed for the Cyprian Plague.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Cyprian Plague was largely a Byzantine problem.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The Cyprian Plague was deadlier.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Authorities quickly neutralized the Cyprian Plague.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Unlike the Justinian Plague, the Cyprian Plague occurred before the Edict of Milan (313 C.E.), which allowed for Christian worship. Prior to the acceptance of Christianity in the Roman Empire, Christians were often blamed for natural phenomena, such as disease outbreaks. The Justinian Empire had strong ties to Christianity, so no such persecution would have occurred. Therefore, the answer is (A).

Modern historians would argue that Mohenjo-Daro indicates the presence of

answers.C: <label>C. sports and recreation</label>
answers.D: <label>D. central government</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

The ancient cities of Mohenjo-Daro and Harappa, which popped up along the Indus River, were notable for the geometric patterns that denote roads, buildings, and other projects. Historians attribute this type of planning and organization to a central government, which is (D).

Based on your knowledge of world history, Mohenjo-Daro had contact with what other ancient civilization?

answers.A: <label>A. Mesopotamia</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Egypt</label>

Historians have found similar coins in both the ruins of the Indus Valley civilizations and of Mesopotamia, (A). This makes sense, as Mesopotamia is the closest, and therefore would be the easiest travel for traders from the Indus Valley. Choice (A) is correct.

content:
"My little homestead in the city, which I recently insured for ï¿¡2,000 would no doubt have shared the common fate, as the insurance companies will not make good that which is destroyed by the Queen's enemies. And although I have a farm of 50 acres close to the town, no doubt the crops and premises would have been destroyed. In fact, this has already partly been the case, and I am now suing the Government for damages done by a contingent of 1,500 natives that have recently encamped not many hundred yards from the place, who have done much damage all around."
Letter from a British citizen to his sister during the Anglo-Zulu War, South Africa, 1879

Incidents such as those described by the author of the letter were used by the British government to do which of the following?

answers.A: <label>A. Issue a casus belli to go to war with the Kingdom of Zulu</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Tax the Zulu kingdom to cover damages attributed to them</label>
answers.C: <label>C. Sever its responsibility to protect citizens who chose to live in South Africa</label>
answers.D: <label>D. Liberate the Zulus from British colonialism</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: A

Explanation:

Casus belli, (A), is just a fancy term that means "reason for war." The British cited conflicts between the colonial settlers and the native Zulu population to demonstrate that the native population was the aggressor. This was important to the British, as a successful war campaign would increase British influence in South Africa.

content:
"My little homestead in the city, which I recently insured for ï¿¡2,000 would no doubt have shared the common fate, as the insurance companies will not make good that which is destroyed by the Queen's enemies. And although I have a farm of 50 acres close to the town, no doubt the crops and premises would have been destroyed. In fact, this has already partly been the case, and I am now suing the Government for damages done by a contingent of 1,500 natives that have recently encamped not many hundred yards from the place, who have done much damage all around."
Letter from a British citizen to his sister during the Anglo-Zulu War, South Africa, 1879

Which of the following reasons explains why European citizens moved in large numbers to Zulu lands in 1867?

answers.A: <label>A. The British crown offered incentives to those who would establish homesteads in the unsettled lands of South Africa.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. The Zulu created attractive trade ports along the Indian Ocean.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The Berlin Conference clarified boundaries, thus making it logistically sound for Europeans to move to the African colonies.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. A diamond rush ensued following the discovery of diamonds on Zulu lands.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: D

Explanation:

As the saying goes, imperial conquest is motivated by the three G's: God, glory, and gold. While none of these is mentioned in the answer choices, (D), diamonds, supports the idea that conquests were often motivated by a desire for riches. Be aware of your timelines, as (C) includes the Berlin Conference, which did not occur until 1884.

Which of the following was a direct effect of the expanding British presence in South Africa in the late nineteenth century?

answers.A: <label>A. South Africa became the most economically successful of all the British colonies.</label>
answers.B: <label>B. Great Britain was penalized at the Berlin Conference with a loss of land.</label>
answers.C: <label>C. The British engaged in a war with South African decedents of the Dutch.</label>
answers.D: <label>D. British settlers created an independent nation.</label>

explanation:
Correct Answer: C

Explanation:

More famous than the Anglo-Zulu War is the Boer War (1899–1902). The British came into conflict with some of the earlier European settlers of South Africa, the Boers (or Afrikaners), who are Dutch descendants. Choice (C) is correct.
